data.title: Blackbaud Opens Office in Mexico to Better Serve Nonprofits in Latin America
data.meta_description: Blackbaud, Inc. (Nasdaq: BLKB) today announced the opening of an office in Mexico City, a new local team, and a reseller agreement with EXITE.TI to su
data.text:
CHARLESTON, S.C.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Blackbaud, Inc. (Nasdaq: BLKB) today announced the opening of an office in Mexico City, a new local team, and a reseller agreement with EXITE.TI to support the growing Latin American philanthropic sector.

“We are investing in growing our presence in Latin America with a new office and a dedicated team to better serve our existing customers and to meet the increased demand for specialized nonprofit software,” said Fernando Ferreira, Blackbaud Latin America’s business development manager, who is based in Mexico. “We are also pleased to announce our partnership with EXITE.TI, who will be the official reseller of Blackbaud products in the region.”

Visit www.blackbaud.tv/nonprofit-news to hear Ferreira’s vision for Blackbaud’s move into Latin America

Blackbaud has been investing in the region since the introduction of eTapestry Español, its first Spanish-language software, in 2010. With this new partnership, EXITE.TI will handle the sales and support of Blackbaud products in Mexico, including eTapestry Español, a web-delivered Spanish-language fundraising and CRM solution designed for small to mid-sized nonprofits to help them fundraise and manage relationships with their constituents. More than 40 nonprofits in Latin America, including small to mid-size organizations and American schools, use eTapestry Español and/or The Education Edge for school administration.

“eTapestry Español was developed to meet the unique needs of nonprofits in Latin America,” said Arturo Soto, EXITE.TI’s owner. “Through our partnership with Blackbaud, we can now provide nonprofits with the tools they need to enhance their relationships with supporters and raise money to support their missions.”

Blackbaud will also collaborate with organizations in Latin America, including: La Federación de Instituciones Mexicanas Particulares de Educación Superior (FIMPES), Centro Mexicano para la Filantropía (CEMEFI), Council for Advancement and Support of Education (CASE Mexico), and the Association of Fundraising Professionals (AFP) to develop its product portfolio to best serve the regional needs of nonprofits.

“AFP has been supporting fundraisers in Mexico since 1993, and we applaud Blackbaud for reaching out to the burgeoning Mexican philanthropic sector,” said Andrew Watt, FInstF, president and CEO of the Association of Fundraising Professionals. “Blackbaud’s Spanish-language fundraising programs will help Mexican nonprofits inspire a new generation of donors.”

The new office is located at Torre Esmeralda II Blvd., Manuel Ávila Camacho No. 36, pisos 10 Col., Lomas de Chapultepec, México DF. CP 11000. For more information about Blackbaud products and services available in Mexico, please visit www.blackbaud.com.mx.

About Blackbaud

Blackbaud is the leading global provider of software and services designed specifically for nonprofit organizations, enabling them to improve operational efficiency, build strong relationships, and raise more money to support their missions. Approximately 24,000 organizations — including The American Red Cross, Cancer Research UK, Earthjustice, International Fund for Animal Welfare, Lincoln Center, The Salvation Army, The Taft School, Tulsa Community Foundation, Ursinus College, the WGBH Educational Foundation, and Yale University — use one or more Blackbaud products and services for fundraising, constituent relationship management, financial management, website management, direct marketing, education administration, ticketing, business intelligence, prospect research, consulting, and analytics. Since 1981, Blackbaud’s sole focus and expertise has been partnering with nonprofits and providing them the solutions they need to make a difference in their local communities and worldwide. Headquartered in the United States, Blackbaud also has operations in Australia, Canada, Hong Kong, Mexico, the Netherlands, and the United Kingdom. For more information, visit www.blackbaud.com.
